inn1.comm: big stride forward, a hint of away-swing, and defended into the gully
wide outside off stump, and curving away. Bell steps out to cover it, but the ball flies harmlessly through to the keeper

oh dear! A bit of swing again, and Bell's attempted leg-glance turns into a loopy leading edge. Daniel Vettori sprints back from mid-off, watches the ball over his shoulder, and safely into his hands. The local lad is gone for a duck
on the legs and tucked safely away, but can't beat midwicket
drawn forward to smother the swing, and defended to point
fuller length, wobbling off the seam a fraction, and defended stoutly
no standing on ceremony for KP. A big outswinger first up, but he watches it onto the bat and punches through the covers for a couple
advancing down the wicket with typical intent, but left alone outside off stump in the end
good outswing and a genuine edge, but Pietersen plays with soft enough hands for the ball to drop short of second slip
angled onto the pads and dabbed to midwicket
finds the gap on the leg side this time, and they scamper through for a single
superb strike. Wright steps down the pitch and inside the line as well, and helps the ball over backward square leg with a firm flick of the wrists. There's no cutting that off
pushed back onto the stumps and defended back down the track
in the channel, six inches outside off, and left well alone
a big stride outside off, and defended
a solid clump of a defensive drive. Mills fields in his followthrough. Pietersen is still looking for his timing
good delivery, and Pietersen is beaten outside off. He's been dancing around in his crease rather a lot
another advance down the pitch, and a punched on-drive flies perilously towards mid-on, but in the end goes safely wide. A bit chancy though
outside off, and an extravagant leave
full and swinging, firmly driven into the covers, but can't pierce the field
solid defence, bat and pad close together and a big stride to boot. Text-book
onto the front foot, and a hint of width as well, and Wright slashes firmly past point
drifting onto the pads, and Hopkins does well to cut off  four leg-byes
an open-shouldered clump through midwicket, inelegant but it finds enough of a gap
banged in short, and cut away off an under-edge. Second slip scampers round to intercept in the gully
into position early, and dabbed into space on the leg side
width, and Wright chases this one with his feet rooted to the crease. No nick though
feet in concrete again, and Wright almost topples over as he reaches for a cut shot. No contact again
stands tall, and attempts to bash Mills straight back down the ground with a cross-batted swipe, but mid-off tidies up
pulled away with gusto, but not a lot of timing. Deep midwicket fields
battered back down the ground, and umpire Ian Gould flings himself to the turf as if being chased by a doodlebug. That travelled ...
whisked round the corner for a single
down the track again, and mowed out to deep midwicket. Pietersen didn't quite middle that shot, but he didn't really need to ...
more fancy footwork, but this time he can't connect properly with a cross-batted swing, and the ball lands safely at his feet
short, and Pietersen misses out again, with a bottom-edged heave into the crease
gave himself room, and Southee spotted him go, an excellent full length outside off, and Pietersen can't connect
short, wide, and clubbed through the covers with a horizontal swing. Fabulous strike
short again, but Ross Taylor at midwicket dives well to intercept
too short again, a poor over so far. Wright climbs into the stroke, up and over point for another boundary
a better length this time, but Wright picks it early, and drills his drive into the deep cover region

half an appeal as Wright steps across his stumps, but it's Pietersen who's in the most trouble as Taylor fields athletically and shies with a backhanded flick at the non-striker's stumps. A direct hit would have been close
on the legs again, but Wright misses out
good line to start and defended
short but straight, Pietersen has a swing, and nearly chops onto his stumps. He's a bit frantic at the moment
a great big yahoo of a wild swing. The ball flies high into the covers, and is given extra impetus by the fierce winds blowing across the ground. Just as well really

and you have to say that was coming. Pietersen never got going today. This was a better length for a full-blooded drive, but his shot was in the air all the way, and Daniel Vettori in the covers made no mistake. A very important breakthrough for New Zealand
drawn forward, and defended solidly on off stump
angled into the pads and Bopara misses out with an attempted flick
good line and length to start, defended into the gully
straight once again, and a bit of excitement as the shy comes in from the gully, but Bopara is so in he's almost out of the frame
slower ball, and a fuller length as well. Tip-and-run cricket, and How's shy from the covers would have been miles out had it hit
accurate once again, and cagily defended
full length and outside off, solidly driven into the covers
angled down the leg side and tidily fielded on the 45. A very good maiden over
a big stride outside leg stump and a full, open swing of the shoulders. Clean as a whistle over the covers
stand and deliver - straight through the line and hit on the up, and thwacked towards the photographers for the first six of the innings
the leg-side tightens up, so Wright launches the ball over midwicket! Cracking strike, Wright hangs back in his crease and swivels into a monstrous shot. Ninety-three yards, apparently
driven furiously into the covers, and Mason oversteps, so a free hit coming up as well ...
full length, a good delivery in the circumstances. Wright under-edges a slog, which trickles out to square leg
a length ball, which would doubtless have been dispatched by Wright. Bopara, on the other hand, choses to bide his time, and his timing
dreadful calling, but a superb dive from Bopara, which saved him as the ball pinged back in from midwicket. There was never a run there
low full-toss, angled into leg stump. Chipped into space at deep mid-on
elegant drive, but no timing. Cover tidies up
slower ball, clipped sweetly to deep midwicket
low full-toss again. Not the worst delivery for the occasion
back of a length, but straight. Driven into the gap in the covers
drilled with gusto, but that's a very unlucky bounce that takes the ball over Daniel Flynn's shoulder and away to the cover boundary. That's Wright's fifty as well, from 33 balls. Well played
dancing feet, and pushed into the covers off the back foot
good variation in pace and flight, and Bopara nearly muffs his shot. In the end it bobbles safely into the crease off an inside-edge
clipped into the leg side
steps back to drive, and picked up in the gully
drawn forward and defended resolutely
quicker delivery, and Wright is beaten as he attempts to cut off the back foot. Hopkins takes at ankle height
clipped to midwicket
slower ball, and cunningly disguised as well. Good spell so far
beaten outside off again

"That's six, that's six, that's out!" declares Cricinfo's Bumble Lloyd, and whatdaya know, he's right! Wright climbed into a massive mow over the covers, but didn't get enough bat on it. Still, a fine momentum-seizing innings. Well bowled by Elliott as well. Steady throughout his spell, plugging away outside off, and earning his reward
steady bowling, full length, straight. Defended
full length and defended to complete a fine - and long - over
down the track and defended
clipped firmly out to deep midwicket, and well scampered between the wickets
not quite to the pitch, and driven on the up to point
missed stumping and that's a shocker as well. Collingwood was dead in the water, and Hopkins had a good sight of the ball as well. But the ball evaded his gloves

it's Keystone Cop stuff out there. Bopara pushed into the covers, attempted a single, turned back, and found Collingwood hurtling for the same end. There was never any doubt that a wicket had fallen, the question was who? After a long delay and several replays, Bopara is sent on his way
full length, and pushed back to the bowler
on the pads and it's turned behind square for a single
good length, just outside off, Shah can't beat the man at point
straight to point again, off the back foot
oh dear, not a good shot at all. Shah tried to turn one to leg and a leading edge pops straight back over the bowler's head and lobs a couple of metres behind the umpire
Collingwood walks all the way across his stumps now and paddle sweeps fine
and there's a much-needed boundary, it's shortish outside off and Collingwood goes back, waits and guides a late cut that runs away just wide of the diving third man
good curve and turn from Vettori, this one spins right past Shah's bat
on the pads now, worked away towards midwicket and they run hard, Elliott fumbles and they get back for two
loop and turn from Vettori, Shah misses with his big attempted sweep
short ball, Shah cuts it away to the man at deep point
half a shout from Vettori, Collingwood was struck in line but he was advancing down the pitch and there's no way the umpire would give that
advances again but can only push to the man at cover
that's a huge six over midwicket! Too straight from Styris and it's a touch short, Shah waits for it and pummels a pull that goes dozens of rows back into the crowd
guided to point and they can't get a run
on the stumps again, this time Shah flicks it away behind square, down towards fine leg for another easy boundary
well outside off, Shah walks all the way across and tries a little paddle sweep, it bounces off his front pad and they get through for a leg bye
outside off again, driveable length and Collingwood opens the shoulders to drive all the way along the ground to long off

that's one of the ugliest fours in a long while. Collingwood got across outside off and tried to paddle sweep, he only managed to scoop it over the keeper's head, but it was effective and ran away towards fine leg
forward and defends this time
a bit of spin now and it's tucked away through midwicket
flatter and quicker, clipped through midwicket again
tossed up outside off, Shah sweeps but doesn't quite time the ball
super shot! Collingwood took several steps down the pitch and picked it up from just outside off, pounding a huge drive well over long on, there was a lot of power in that shot
pushed away through mid on and they scamper back for two
wide outside off, a half-volley and Shah just reaches from his stance to squeeze a single out to the off side
outside off, Collingwood walks across and turns a single to short fine leg
down leg side, a touch slower and Shah's attempted slog misses, but it's definitely a wide
full toss, outside off and Shah doesn't quite pick it up as cleanly as he would like, drives in the air down to long on, one bounce and the fielder collects
a big swipe outside off now and Collingwood can't make contact
Collingwood gets a long way outside off and Elliott follows him, the batsman pushes a single away

another wicket for Elliott! Slower ball this time, 60.5mph, Shah rooted to the crease and tries for a cross-batted slog over midwicket, he's struck on the pad dead in front and that's an easy decision for Steve Davis.
outside off, Collingwood can't get it away through the off side
on the stumps now, Collingwood waits and punches through midwicket and they run two, great running
this time only a single as Collingwood turns it through midwicket
punches a single along the ground to long off
a touch flatter, on the stumps and Collingwood clips two more to deep midwicket
wider outside off now, Collingwood advances and has to reach, he can't beat the man at cover
low full toss, on off stump and it's driven down to long off
a bit of width outside off now, Collingwood backs away and slashes, a thick edge flies over the short third man for four

excellent catch from Flynn! Elliott's slower ball does the job again. Wide outside off, Collingwood drives hard in the air towards deep cover, Flynn runs in and takes the catch diving forward at full stretch. Well held.
the batsmen crossed there, so Mascarenhas on strike and he drives straight back past the bowler for a single
slower ball and yorker length, Ambrose can't beat cover
shortish ball, pulled away to short midwicket
not a bad ball first up, yorker length outside off and it's driven away to mid off
good ball again, full enough and Ambrose can't get bat on ball outside off
a bit of swing outside off, full length and Ambrose simply can't connect with his attempted drive
similar ball outside off, this time Ambrose does squeeze the ball into the off side and they get through for a run
that one's too wide, well outside off and he'll bowl that again
half-volley and too wide outside off, Mascarenhas just throws the bat out there and his thick edge flies in the air to the vacant third man boundary
wide outside off again, Mascarenhas flays a cover-drive in the air, it rockets away but there's a man at deep cover
half-volley on off, Mascarenhas can't quite get under it and he has to settle for a single from his mis-timed drive to mid on
low full toss on the stumps, Ambrose tries to clip it through leg and it lobs straight to Taylor at midwicket. Straightfoward catch
outside off and Swann's punch off the back foot flies in the air just behind point, narrowly avoiding a diving Jamie How
full toss again, Mascarenhas simply flicks it over midwicket, well placed
that's a yorker on the stumps, Mascarenhas' drive is so straight it clips the off stump at the bowler's end and the deflection lets them get through for two
low full toss again, Mascarenhas drives to long on
outside off, a half-volley is driven hard to long off, Mason should have kept it to one but his misfield lets them get two
well struck, it's a full toss on the stumps and Mascarenhas slams it back past the bowler towards long on for four

and there goes Mascarenhas. Southee had been pitching them full, he digs this one in short outside off, Mascarenhas tries to pull and his top edge flies high towards square leg, Hopkins runs around and makes excellent ground, diving forward in the end to take a super catch.
and Southee gets another! Short on the stumps now, Swann's swipe turns into a top edge that flies straighter up in the air and this one is an easier catch for Hopkins
oh, that didn't miss the stumps by much! Southee bowled full this time, it swung in a touch and Broad's swing didn't make contact, the ball missed off stump by a couple of inches
and a good finish for New Zealand. Southee puts it fullish again, Broad drives out towards deep cover and they try to scamper back for two but Flynn's throw to Hopkins finds Broad a long way short

inn2.comm: and he starts with a wide swinging away outside off
take two, and that's almost the same delivery, and exactly the same result. Inauspicious start, that
on line now, How defends to the off side
swings away outside off and it's left alone
outside off, How defends
ths one swings away again, How leaves it alone, he's in no hurry
on the pads and How clips it away through midwicket for the first runs off the bat
How defends to cover
that would have been a wide, swinging away outside off and McCullum has a big swish, the thick edge flies on the bounce to third man
and there's some luck for How. He's tried to pull from outside off, the ball didn't rise as much as he expected and a thick bottom edge hurtles past the stumps and away to fine leg for a boundary
on line now, and How defends
short again, How on the front foot to pull and it runs away to deep square leg
short outside off and McCullum tries to cut, it beats his bat
McCullum tries to dab fine behind point again but can't connect
good length outside off, How punches off the back foot to cover
thick edge away through the vacant gully position and they get a single to third man
angled in to hips now, McCullum doesn't walk across and work to leg, instead squeezing it to cover in a rather ugly way
fullish ball on the stumps, How drives but can't beat cover
angled in again, it bobs up off How's pad and they scramble a leg bye
McCullum walks down the pitch early, Anderson pulls his length back a touch and all McCullum can do is bunt a single to cover
McCullum walks down again, and across his stumps, he clips Broad's yorker away towards fine leg and Wright's chase cuts off what would have been a boundary
half-volley outside off, How drives to mid off
excellent cover-drive, a touch full and swinging away, How is quickly down onto one knee and guides it through cover with perfect timing
just a fraction outside off stump, cutting in a fraction and How's inside edge runs away to the fine-leg boundary. Lucky shot from How.
on the back foot and defending again
and Broad breaks through! Angled it in towards the pads of How, who tried to clip through the leg side but couldn't keep the ball down and it went straight to Shah at short midwicket

on the pads first up, it's clipped through midwicket and there should not have been two there. Pietersen should have cut it off, he was a touch laid-back, and then after he missed the ball Wright collected and his through to Ambrose was wide, allowing McCullum to get back
straight ball again, tucked away to leg for a run
Taylor watchful for his first delivery, prods it back down the pitch to Collingwood
on line again, good length as well and Taylor can't beat midwicket
slower ball now, and it's a yorker to boot, so all Taylor can do is drive to mid on

oh, Collingwood nearly does the job! Taylor was forward, lunging at one that swung away a touch outside off, he missed and his foot was dangerously in the air. Ambrose whipped the bails off but the third umpire confirmed Taylor's foot was just down in time.
bad ball to start, down leg side and it's bounced a bit, Ambrose does well to collect it cleanly
a touch short outside off now, but not really that wide, and McCullum steps backward a fraction and his square cut rockets off the bat and races away for four
better ball, on off stump and a shade fuller, McCullum pushes to point
outside off and jagging in a bit, but McCullum had time to see it and drove off the back-foot forward of point
Taylor can't beat the field now, pushes this one to cover
oh, edgy from Taylor. It was right on line, he tried to close the face and tuck it to leg, the leading edge skewed away through the vacant gully region
nudges this one to mid off, who's back far enough that they get an easy single
this one holds up a bit off the pitch, straight ball and McCullum waits to guide it to point, can't beat the field
great ball, that one has swung in and also nipped sharply off the pitch, it came back so far that McCullum was surprised into an inventive defensive shot
cross-bat stuff now from McCullum, that's really just a baseball slog down to long on, it bounces on its way down there
jags in again, McCullum cuts to point

and Taylor gets his first boundary, although it's not hugely convincing. Collingwood dropped a bit short, it cut back into Taylor and he pulled, it ran away behind square, though not at all timed well
down leg side, bad ball and Taylor clips it off his pads in the air to fine leg

wide outside off, McCullum walks so far outside his stumps that he would have been standing on off for a second set of stumps, and he drives a half-volley superbly through extra cover. Great timing and placement
walks a long way a cross again, but defends this time
oh, just wide of Mascarenhas at short fine leg. It's a short ball, on the stumps, McCullum swings a hook behind square and the fielder dives in vain. It wasn't far away though
push and run now, McCullum just nudges to point
half-volley outside off, Taylor drives but can't quite beat the man at mid off
turned away from outside off forward of square leg
McCullum steps right across immediately, before the ball is bowled, Anderson angles it in and strikes him on the knee roll but he's not in line, and they run a leg bye
good length now and Taylor is on the back foot, driving square to point

that was a wild, woolly slog and Taylor has had a stroke of luck. He really was just trying to pound a half-volley on the stumps over midwicket, and an inside edge has missed leg stump by what must have been millimetres
now that is a deserved boundary! On the stumps and angled in a touch, Taylor picks it up so quickly and gets foward, driving between midwicket and mid on with precision and power
good length and it jags in to Taylor, striking him on the thigh pad and there's a leg bye
sharpish shortish ball, on the hips, McCullum tucks it in the air to square leg, but there's nobody there
there's turn immediately, in towards the stumps and McCullum pads it away
outside off and McCullum punches to cover
tossed up nicely, good loop from Swann, but McCullum does well to clip it between midwicket and mid on
a bit faster and flatter, Taylor gets down on one knee to slog flat through midwicket, it runs away quickly but the man in the deep makes good ground
that's what Taylor was perhaps looking for last ball. On one knee again, slog sweeping from outside off and it's flown in the air over wide midwicket, wide enough that the fielder can't get there
tucked away to square leg
slowish ball from Collingwood, outside off and McCullum waits and guides it behind gully for a single
Taylor walks across very early, Collingwood puts it on the stumps and Taylor's attempted slog clips off the inside edge onto the pad
short outside off, Taylor cuts hard into the ground and straight to point
Taylor slams this one baseball-style from outside off, it runs away to long on
not much pace on that delivery, it's just short of yorker length and McCullum nudges away to mid off

a low full toss on the stumps, Taylor slogs again but he doesn't get enough of it and finds the man at deep midwicket. England must have known that was coming, the way Taylor was slogging everything in the last over or so
plays around his front pad, and a slight yelp of an appeal from behind the stumps
turned to midwicket but can't find the gap
into space on the leg side this time, and Styris is off the mark
probing length on off stump. Defended
tickled fine, but picked up easily by short backward square
tucked into space behind square. A tidy, and successful, over
outside off and hammered hard into the deep on the off side. The sweeper tidies up
full length on off stump, Styris shapes for a drive but can't time it
rocks onto the back foot, and Owais Shah's sluggish fielding at deep cover gifts New Zealand a second run
slower-ball bouncer. Styris waits and waits, and eventually swats behind square for a single
angled towards leg stump, clipped to midwicket
another slower ball, a full looping length outside off stump, and drilled into the off side
floated into the blockhole, firmly driven but well parried by Bell at short cover
clipped into the leg side
driven up to mid-on. New Zealand are content to deal in singles
defended on off stump
tidy line and length, McCullum is like a coiled spring, but he can't make anything of that
tickled behind square, and that's the end of a handy over for England
misdirected, and that's a poor start. A gimme for McCullum who puts bat on ball and deflects it all the way to the boundary
pushed into the covers
an attempted paddle-sweep, inelegantly executed, but a single nonetheless to square leg
pushed to backward point and McCullum hares back for a second
nice delivery, just nicks off the seam a touch, and McCullum edges a single to third man
half an appeal for a full-length floater, but plenty bat on that shot as the ball is pushed up to long-on
driven up to mid-on
reverse sweep, and well played too - beats the diving Pietersen at gully and has the legs to go all the way
strayed outside leg stump, clipped to deep square leg, and that's his fifty. Only 42 balls, and he's hardly put the pedal to the metal
defended on off and middle
tapped into the covers to rotate the strike again
a hurtled single, if the shy from short backward square had hit, it could have been very close. Swann is sent tumbling as McCullum slides his body underneath him, but no damage done
good start, swinging in with the arm and nearly snaking through McCullum's defences
defended back to the bowler
good shout, and very close, just trimming the bails on the Hawkeye replay
pushed into the covers. It's looking awfully misty out there now
driven into the covers, and a superb interception from Bell, who reaches to his right, goalkeeper-style
a swing and a miss. Styris is not timing the ball just yet, but with McCullum at the other end, he doesn't need to
back of a length, and pushed out to deep point.
plenty singles on offer in the deep on the off side
tighter to off stump, and short midwicket cleans up
onto the back foot and driven hard. A good shot, and good running too
floated up outside off stump, tempting the big drive, but no - another single into the gap at midwicket
attempted reverse-sweep, but Styris can't make contact. A yelp of an appeal but never in line for the lbw

too short and swatted hard into the deep. James Anderson makes great ground to field, but is he touching the rope as he slides round? An interminable delay, which funnily enough may suit England as the rain closes in, and finally the verdict is no
punch to long-off
yorker, and a good one too. A valuable dot ball
swung out to deep midwicket. Good connection, but still no boundary
there's the boundary, and it's a bit of a flukey one too. A genuine outside-edge as the yorker is squeezed out, and third man can't intercept
right into the blockhole again - good bowling - and McCullum declines the second as long-on swoops
